description: End of class quiz for Session 5: Logical Operators (AND, OR, NOT)

questions.question: What does the 'and' operator do?
options: Returns True if at least one side is True
Returns True only if both sides are True
questions.explanation: AND requires both conditions to be True for the result to be True.

questions.question: What is True and False?
questions.explanation: AND needs both to be True. One is False, so result is False.

questions.question: What does the 'or' operator do?
options: Returns True if both sides are True
Returns True if at least one side is True
questions.explanation: OR returns True if either the left or the right (or both) is True.

questions.question: What is False or True?
questions.explanation: OR returns True if at least one is True. Here, right side is True.

questions.question: What does 'not' do?
options: Reverses True to False and False to True
questions.explanation: NOT flips a Boolean: not True â†’ False, not False â†’ True.

questions.question: You can enter a club if you are over 18 AND have an ID. If age=20, has_id=True, can you enter?
questions.explanation: Both conditions are True (20>18 and has_id=True), so AND returns True.

questions.question: A light turns on if switch1 is ON OR switch2 is ON. Switch1=False, Switch2=True. Does the light turn on?
questions.explanation: OR needs at least one True. Switch2 is True, so light turns on.

questions.question: What is (True and False) or True?
questions.explanation: Inside ( ): True and False = False. Then False or True = True.

questions.question: Logical operators help programs:
options: Make decisions based on multiple conditions
questions.explanation: AND, OR, NOT allow combining conditions to decide what to do next.

title: Session 5: Logical Operators - End of Class Quiz
